alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 29 at 7:52PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following county, Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 300 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 746 PM PDT, gauge reports indicated Green Valley Creek at Martinelli Road is in minor flood stage, and Mark West Creek near Mirabel Heights is in monitor stage. A few additional showers are expected this evening and overnight, and poor- drainage and small stream flooding is expected to continue. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Rohnert Park, Sebastopol, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Forestville and Graton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
